Answers to the question \"at what point: When a mendicant truly understands the origin and ending of the six sense fields
When a mendicant truly understands the origin and ending of the five grasping aggregates
When a mendicant truly understands the origin and ending of the four primary elements
When a mendicant truly understands that everything that has a beginning has an end
The simile of the parrot tree [sn35.245:: A person who has never seen a parrot tree asks someone who has seen it what it is like
The person who has seen the parrot tree describes it as blackish
The person who has never seen a parrot tree asks other people what it is like and receives different answers
Each person answers according to what they were focused on when their vision was well purified
The simile of the king's frontier citade: Swift messengers arrive from different directions and ask the gatekeeper where the lord of the city is
The gatekeeper points them to the central square where the lord of the city is seated
The messengers deliver a message of truth to the lord of the city and depart the way they came

The simile is explained, with each element representing a different aspect of the body and mind, including mindfulness, serenity, discernment, and consciousness. The noble eightfold path is also mentioned as the way to extinguishment.
